heading: # Toolbars
headingText: The `v-toolbar` component is pivotal to any gui, as it generally is the primary source of site navigation. The toolbar component works great in conjunction with [v-navigation-drawer](/components/navigation-drawers) and [v-card](/components/cards).
buttonMargin: When `<v-btn>`s with the **icon** prop are used inside of `v-toolbar` and `v-app-bar` they will automatically have their size increased and negative margin applied to ensure proper spacing according to the Material Design Specification. If you choose to wrap your buttons in any container, such as a `<div>`, you will need to apply negative margin to that container in order to properly align them.

usage.desc: A toolbar is a flexible container that can be used in a number of ways. By default, the toolbar is 64px high on desktop and 56px high on mobile. There are a number of helper components available to use with the toolbar. The `v-toolbar-title` is used for displaying a title and `v-toolbar-items` allow [v-btn](/components/buttons) to extend full height.

light-and-dark.heading: ### Light and Dark
light-and-dark.desc: Toolbars come in **2** variants, light and dark. Light toolbars have dark tinted buttons and dark text whereas dark toolbars have white tinted buttons and white text.

flexible-and-card.heading: ### Flexible toolbar and card toolbar
flexible-and-card.desc: In this example we offset our card onto the extended content area of a toolbar using the **extended** prop.

floating-with-search.heading: ### Floating with search
floating-with-search.desc: A floating toolbar is turned into an inline element that only takes up as much space as needed. This is particularly useful when placing toolbars over content.

variations.heading: ### Variations
variations.desc: A `v-toolbar` has multiple variations that can be applied with themes and helper classes. These range from light and dark themes, colored and transparent.

prominent.heading: ### Prominent toolbars
prominent.desc: Prominent toolbars increase the `v-toolbar`'s height to _128px_ and positions the `v-toolbar-title` towards the bottom of the container. This is expanded upon in [v-app](/components/app-bars#prominent-w-scroll-shrink) with the ability to shrink a **prominent** toolbar to a **dense** or **short** one.

dense.heading: ### Dense toolbars
dense.desc: Dense toolbars reduce their height to _48px_. When using in conjunction with the **prominent** prop, will reduce height to _96px_.

dense-prominent.heading: ### Dense prominent toolbars
dense-prominent.desc: You can combine both the prominent and dense properties.

scrolling.heading: ### Scrolling techniques
scrolling.desc: A toolbar can transition off screen when scrolling. Here we demonstrate how you can specify the scroll target (default is window). Note: for this example there is special markup that will not be required in your application.

system-bars-status-window.heading: ### System bars - status/window
system-bars-status-window.desc: System bars are useful for notification icons on mobile and desktop. For live examples of these, head to the pre-defined layouts.

contextual-action-bar.heading: ### Contextual action bars
contextual-action-bar.desc: It is possible to update the appearance of a toolbar in response to changes in app state. In this example, the color and content of the toolbar changes in response to user selections in the `v-select`.

background.heading: ### Prominent w/ Background
background.desc: Toolbars can display a background as opposed to a solid color. This can be modified by using the **img** slot and providing your own [v-img](/components/images) component. Backgrounds can be faded using a [v-app-bar](/components/app-bars#prominent-w-scroll-shrink-and-image).

extended.heading: ### Extended
extended.desc: Toolbars can be extended without using the `extension` slot.

extension-height.heading: ### Extension height
extension-height.desc: The extension's height can be customized.

collapse.heading: ### Collapse
collapse.desc: Toolbars can be collapsed to save screen space.

props.collapse: Puts the toolbar into a collapsed state reducing its maximum width.
props.dense: Reduces the height of the toolbar content to 48px (96px when using the **prominent** prop).
props.extended: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.
props.extensionHeight: Specify an explicit height for the `extension` slot.
props.height: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.
props.prominent: Increases the height of the toolbar content to 128px.
props.short: Reduce the height of the toolbar content to 56px (112px when using the **prominent** prop).
props.src: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

slots.extension: Slot positioned directly under the main content of the toolbar. Height of this slot can be set explicitly with the **extension-height** prop. If this slot has no content, the **extended** prop may be used instead.
slots.img: Expects the [v-img](/components/images) component. Scoped **props** should be applied with `v-bind="props"`.
